body_html:
Sorry about the delayed response (and I didn't see the edit, because I don't get notifications for comment edits).

So, it's not just "subtle build system changes" that require a re-cmake. If you add a new source file, and that source file is read in by cmake via a glob, you need to re-cmake; cmake is not going to auto-cmake in that case https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32411963/why-is-cmake-file-glob-evil

I'm generally in favor of two commands: one that lets the user run cmake+make, and one that just runs make (when you know you're not mucking around with file structure, just code). So your proposal in edit SGTM.
